columns.text: In this problem, we need to find the amount of the company’s accounts receivable, and then determine how will  accounts receivable change if the company changes its credit policy and offers credit to its customers with terms of $2/10$, net 30.

Company Essence of Skunk Fragrances, Ltd., sells $7,900$ units of parfume each year  at a price per unit of $\$385$. A company offers terms of $1/10$, net $40$. Based on experience, $65$  percent of its customers take advantage of the discount.

To find the amount of the company’s accounts receivable, first, we need to find the  average collection period, which is denoted by $\text{ACP}$. 

The ACP is equal to the percentage of invoices that take the discount multiplied by the discount period, plus the percentage of orders that do not take the discount multiplied by the day until full payment is required, so
$$\begin{align*}
\text{ACP}&=0.65\cdot 10\hspace{1mm}\text{days}+0.35\cdot 40\hspace{1mm}\text{days}\\
&=6.5\hspace{1mm}\text{days}+14\hspace{1mm}\text{days}\\
&=20.5\hspace{1mm}\text{days}
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the average collection period is 20.5 days.**

Compny sells $7,900$ units of parfume each year at a price of $\$385$ each. So,the average balance sheet amount in accounts receivable is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Accounts receivable}&=\text{Average daily sales}\cdot \text{ACP}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{7,900\cdot\$385}{365}\cdot 20.5\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$3,041,500}{365}\cdot 20.5\\[15pt]
&=\$170,823.97\\
\end{align*}$$

**Hence, accounts receivable is amount of $170,823.97.**

The company wants to change its credit policy and offer it to its customers credit with terms of $2/10$, net 30.  Then,  average collection period will be 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{ACP}&=0.65\cdot 10\hspace{1mm}\text{days}+0.35\cdot 30\hspace{1mm}\text{days}\\
&=6.5\hspace{1mm}\text{days}+10.5\hspace{1mm}\text{days}\\
&=17\hspace{1mm}\text{days}
\end{align*}$$

**If the company changes its credit policy, then the average collection period would be 17 days.**

If the company changes its credit policy, the amount of the company’s accounts receivable will be
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Accounts receivable}&=\text{Average daily sales}\cdot \text{ACP}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{7,900\cdot\$385}{365}\cdot 17\\[15pt]
&=\$141,658.9
\end{align*}$$

**As can be seen, if the company changes its credit policy then the the amount of the company’s accounts receivable decreases.**
